instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-4924: What is 820-4924? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.PP3V3_S5: What is PP3V3_S5? PP3V3_S5 is a 3.3v power rail when the system is in an S5 soft off power state.
definitions.PP3V42_G3H: What is PP3V42_G3H? PP3V42_G3H is a power rail present when the machine is in a G3H global system hardware off state and is the first rail that should be generated in Macbooks that use it. .
definitions.PP5V_S5: What is PP5V_S5? This is a 5v power rail that is present when the machine is in an S5 soft off state..
definitions.SMC_RESET_L: What is SMC_RESET_L? SMC_RESET_L puts the SMC into reset mode when it is low, _L means the signal is present when voltage is low. The SMC being in reset mode keeps it from running..
definitions.PPVRTC_G3H: What is PPVRTC_G3H? PPVRTC_G3H is a 3.3v power rail for the RTC circuit present when the machine is in a G3H global system hardware off state. .
definitions.PP5V_S3: What is PP5V_S3? PP5V_S3 is a 5v power rail present when the system is in an S3 suspend to RAM state..
definitions.PP3V3_S4: What is PP3V3_S4? The "PP3V3_S4" power rail in a MacBook is used to supply 3.3 volts to certain components when the system is in the S4 power state, also known as "suspend to disk" or "hibernate." This rail is active when the MacBook is not fully off but not in an awake state, allowing for faster startup times compared to a full boot sequence. The S4 power state means Suspend to Disk: This is a low-power state where the system context is saved to disk, allowing the system to be powered down almost entirely. Upon waking, the system can restore its state from the disk, effectively resuming where it left off..
definitions.PP5V_S4: What is PP5V_S4? PP5V_S4 is a 5v power rail present when the machine is in an S4 suspend to disk state..
definitions.PM_SLP_S4_L: What is PM_SLP_S4_L? PM_SLP_S4_L is a signal that puts the system into an S4 suspend to disk sleep state when it is low(_L means signal is asserted when voltage is low).
definitions.U1950: What is U1950? This chip often becomes corroded on pin 8 on the PP3V42_G3H pin causing PM_SLP_S4_L to go missing.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> with green/orange light but not turning on.
threads.message:
Hi, i have a <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not turning on.. no water damage, no corrosion. nothing.

I think is stuck at S5 state. But I donâ€™t know where start look why is stuck in there.

There my measures.

<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> @ <CAPACITOR>C7900</CAPACITOR> : 12.56v
<SIGNAL>PP3V42_G3H</SIGNAL> @ <CAPACITOR>C4850</CAPACITOR> : 3.42v
<SIGNAL>PPVRTC_G3H</SIGNAL> @ <CAPACITOR>C1910</CAPACITOR> : 3.33v
<SIGNAL>PP5V_S5</SIGNAL> @ <CAPACITOR>C7505</CAPACITOR> : 5.05V
<SIGNAL>PP5V_S4</SIGNAL> @ 0v
<SIGNAL>PP5V_S3</SIGNAL> @0v
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5</SIGNAL> @ <CAPACITOR>C8000</CAPACITOR> : 3.33v
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S4</SIGNAL> @ 0v
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S3</SIGNAL> @ 0v 
<SIGNAL>SMC_RESET_L</SIGNAL> @ <RESISTOR>R5100</RESISTOR> : 3.36v

The board looks very well.. I dont know where start looking.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> with green/orange light but not turning on.
threads.message: Green/orange light working? Using a 60W charger?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> with green/orange light but not turning on.
threads.message: I try some chargers.. include the original 60w and 85w. Same result.. with any charger have green light / orange light on the charger but doesn't turns on.

<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> with green/orange light but not turning on.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> with green/orange light but not turning on.
threads.message: How is <SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S4_L</SIGNAL> doing? Anything ugly around <CHIP>U1900</CHIP>?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> with green/orange light but not turning on.
threads.message:
Is nothing ugly. i have some boards with the same issue. all of them are retinas non touch bar.

<SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S4_L</SIGNAL> is 0v

i dont know works the thinks with the <SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S4_L</SIGNAL>.. what i need first? where need to look? why always stuck in the S5 State? should be the PCH? i don't know !!

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> with green/orange light but not turning on.
threads.message: I think some 4924 boards need a good battery connected to boot.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> with green/orange light but not turning on.
threads.message:
[QUOTE="dukefawks, post: 24826"]I think some 4924 boards need a good battery connected to boot.[/QUOTE]

This is happening to me with several models of macbook pro retina non touchbar. not only with the 4924. i will going to proof and i let u know how im going.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> with green/orange light but not turning on.
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> with green/orange light but not turning on.
threads.message: Check all rails for shorts, PPVRTC present? <CHIP>U1900</CHIP>/<CHIP>U1950</CHIP> corrosion?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> with green/orange light but not turning on.
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> with green/orange light but not turning on.
threads.message: PPVRTC is present, No corrosion on neither

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> with green/orange light but not turning on.
